results.title: Unzipped
results.creator_credit: Hachette Fillpacchi Productions, Michael Alden and Douglas Keeve
results.brief_description: Isaac Mizrahi is a talented New York fashion designer, who, after receiving negative reviews for his 1994 Spring collection, is in need of a successful season. This documentary tracks the evolution of Mizrahi’s next collection - from fledging moments of inspiration to final parade. “Unzipped” is a frank examination of the fashion industry at work - the superficiality, demands, personalities, exhaustion, frustrations, setbacks, camaraderie and creativity of it all. Supermodels take centre stage and the precociousness of this elite group is in evident abundance. Mizrahi seeks guidance from a diverse range of sources (including a ouija board) as he aims to evoke the look and style of an Inuit, mixed with 1950s cheesecake aesthetic, meets Mary Tyler Moore. Mizrahi’s mother is interviewed and gives insights into her son’s precocious talent, recognised and nurtured by her. Directed by Douglas Keeve, “Unzipped” is a candid examination of the sparks that fly when creative urges seek to ally financial interest. Features appearances from Naomi Campbell, Linda Evangelista, Cindy Crawford, Helena Christensen, Richard Gere, Eartha Kitt, Sandra Bernhard and Kate Moss. Winner of the Audience Award at the 1995 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: Universal soldier
results.creator_credit: Corolco Pictures, Allen Shapiro, Craig Baumgarten, Joel B Michaels and Roland Emmerich
results.brief_description: Vietnam soldiers Luc Devreaux (Jean-Claude Van Damme), and Andrew Scott (Dolph Lundgren) are killed in combat. Their bodies are used in a secret government experiment of mixing man with machine. The two were sworn enemies in life and the experiment was supposed to have erased all memories but they rediscover the fierce hate between them as two fighting machines battle one another to the death. Also starring Ally Walker, Ed O’Ross and Jerry Orbach. This video contains 11 minutes of extra footage not screened in cinemas.

results.title: Unidentified flying oddball
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ron Miller and Russ Mayberry
results.brief_description: Based on Mark Twain’s ‘A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court’ this Disney film version provides a new twist to the story by setting it in today’s space age. NASA scientist Tom Trimble (Dennis Dugan) and his robot clone accidentally find themselves travelling back in time to the land of merry England and the court of King Arthur (Kenneth More). Here Trimble encounters the lovely Alisande (Sheila White), King Arthur’s enemy the evil knight Sir Mordred (Jim Dale), and Merlin (Ron Moody) the Court’s magician. Will Trimble be drawn into Sir Mordred’s evil plot to oust King Arthur or will he save the day and in doing so stop history from being changed forever? Cast includes John Le Mesurier as Sir Gawain.

results.title: Unhook the stars
results.creator_credit: Hachette Premiere, Rene Cleitman, Panos Nicolaou and Nick Cassavetes
results.brief_description: Gena Rowlands portrays a middle-aged widow whose life is on the threshold of change. Her daughter has just left home on less than amicable terms and her married son is totally absorbed in his own life. When Mildred is approached by her neighbour (Marissa Tomei) to mind her young son, JJ, after her abusive husband walks out, she immediately consents. Initially quiet and tentative, JJ gradually gains confidence as the two develop a strong bond which provides them with the support they lack from their own families. The film explores the evolving relationship between Mildred and her two children, contrasting it to the unconditional friendship she shares with JJ. Cast includes Gena Rowlands, Marisa Tomei, Gerard Depardieu and Jake Lloyd. Edited by Petra Von Oelffen. Photographed by Phedon Papamichael. Written by Nick Cassavetes and Helen Caldwell.

results.title: Unforgiven [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Malpaso Company and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood’s film is an exciting modern classic that rode off with four 1992 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Director. Eastwood and Morgan Freeman play retired down-on-their-luck outlaws who pick up their guns one last time to collect a bounty offered by the vengeful prostitutes of the remote Wyoming town of Big Whiskey. Richard Harris is an ill-fated interloper, a colourful killer for hire called English Bob. Gene Hackman is the sly and brutal local sheriff whose brand of law enforcement ranges from unconventional to ruthless. Big trouble is coming to Big Whiskey.

results.title: Unfaithfully yours (1984)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Daniel Melnick, Joe Wizan, Marvin Worth and Howard Zieff
results.brief_description: This remake of the 1948 Preston Sturges classic stars Dudley Moore as the symphony conductor who imagines ways to get back at the wife he believes is unfaithful to him. As his jeaslousy escalates, the disastrous after-shocks provide an arrary of farcical situations as Claude lays traps, fantasizes about double murder and sets about stalking his prey. Also stars Armand Assante and Natassja Kinski.

results.title: Undead
results.creator_credit: Spierigfilm, Imagine Entertainment (US), Michael Spierig and Peter Spierig
results.brief_description: Australian twin filmmaking brothers, Michael and Peter Spierig, have written, produced and directed this, their first feature film. They have achieved their goal of creating a schlock splatter horror with a load of laughs but with a sci-fi alien plot twist that makes it stands out. What also stands out is the finish of the film as its low budget is not that evident in the final outcome. Fictional small Australian country town of Berkeley, renowned for its good fishing, is invaded by aliens that send strange meteors from space turning people into the undead - zombies. The local beauty contest winner Rene (Felicity Mason) is about to leave town but is prevented when her driver becomes victim to zombie attack. The local town loony, a tall silent bloke called Marion (Mungo McKay), comes to her aid with a three-barrelled custom-made rifle. Blood, gore, splatter and laughs aplenty ensue as our hapless heroes (including the swearing town cop and his rookie constable, Wayne and his pregnant girlfriend) go about surviving the onslaught of brain sucking zombies. The aliens appear on earth cleansing some folks with healing rain and they are then ascended to orbit the earth. The ending has the potential for a sequel and hopefully someone will give them the money! This is must see cult classic for those into the schlock/horror or low budget independent genre/s. Crew that deserve special mention are the make-up designer Steven Boyle, cinematographer Andrew Strahorn, composer Cliff Bradley and everyone that worked on the special effects, which includes the directors. (“The Making Of” in the extras is worth a look if you’re thinking of making a low budget feature!) Hopefully there will be more from The Spierig Brothers in the future. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Umberto D
results.creator_credit: DEAR Film, Nino Misiano and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Italian directors of the post-WWII generation, responding to the calamity of facism, to the widespread poverty in both the cities and countryside, and by necessity needing to film inexpensively and to be unencumbered by studio costs, developed a radical realist cinematic aesthetics: neo-realism. Vittorio De Sica became justly famous for his groundbreaking “The Bicycle Thieves”, utilising street locations and performances by non-actors, but it is his unsentimental “Umberto D” that now stands up as the most important film of the Italian neo-realist period. Umberto is a retired civil servant who finds himself unwanted and ignored now that his working days are over. Only his dog gives him affection; humans treat him as already dead, an old man to be shoved aside if they even see him at all. Almost documentary-like in its observation of Umberto (played with sustained brilliance by Carlo Battisti), the film quickly envelops us in the old man’s daily struggles and we find ourselves completely mesmerised by his story, we find ourselves identifying with this tale of a most ordinary “unremarkable” man. As Umberto faces his aching loneliness, and death seemingly becomes his only salvation, we as viewers have to confront our own immersion in the sterility and brutality of our industrialised urban world. The great critic Pauline Kael argued that “Umberto D” is one of those rare films that changes the viewer, that on once seeing the film you can never view the world in the same way again. Critic George Kaufman called it one of “the greatest halfdozen films ever made”. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Ulee's gold
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Clinica Estetico and Victor Nunez
results.brief_description: This touching film presents a subtle study of the difficulties and complexities involved in the development and maintenance of lasting human relations. It reveals how abnormal events force one self-exiled loner to reassess his moral and emotional beliefs and to redeem his sense of personal and familial strength. Ulee, a Vietnam veteran turned beekeeper, in the tradition of generations before him, watches his family disintegrate when his son, Jimmy, lands in jail for robbery and his daughter-in-law disappears, leaving their two daughters in Ulee’s care. Ulee takes refuge from this state of affairs in the production of his high-grade honey with the unspoken assistance of his youngest granddaughter. However, when Jimmy’s partners begin threatening his family, thinking that Jimmy has hidden the proceeds of their robbery, Ulee’s stubbornly suppressed sense of the unconditional bond and care that links his family begins to surface and he becomes involved in the tenuous situation. Nunez handles this film with a simplicity and sensitivity that effectively evokes the personal journey of Ulee and the rest of his family in challenging circumstances.

It reveals how abnormal events force one self-exiled loner to reassess his moral and emotional beliefs and to redeem his sense of personal and familial strength. Ulee, a Vietnam veteran turned beekeeper, in the tradition of generations before him, watches his family disintegrate when his son, Jimmy, lands in jail for robbery and his daughter-in-law disappears, leaving their two daughters in Ulee’s care. Ulee takes refuge from this state of affairs in the production of his high-grade honey with the unspoken assistance of his youngest granddaughter. However, when Jimmy’s partners begin threatening his family, thinking that Jimmy has hidden the proceeds of their robbery, Ulee’s stubbornly suppressed sense of the unconditional bond and care that links his family begins to surface and he becomes involved in the tenuous situation. Nunez handles this film with a simplicity and sensitivity that effectively evokes the personal journey of Ulee and the rest of his family in challenging circumstances.
